result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin J. May in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Justin J. May in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews warrant summary.  State agrees with and request same revocation summary as writer, 1 year Sauk County Jail with Huber privileges.  Convert any unpaid to civil judgment.  121 days credit.  No opposition to jail transfers.   Attorney Lawton agrees with 121 days credit.  Request 8 months Sauk County Jail with Huber privileges.  2.6 years remaining on probation.  Court admonishes defendant and sentences as follows:
Count 1:
1 year Sauk County Jail, with Huber privileges.  Consecutive.  121 days credit.  
Convert any unpaid costs to civil judgment, however continual payments to be withdrawn from Huber account as has been occurring.  
Transfer to Juneau County Jail approved, per jail rules.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling conference on June 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Justin J. May in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
18 months Probation
DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
$443.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)

Count 2:  Dismissed but read in
Paperwork handed in court
Cover Letter from J.P. to Court

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Auth filed and approved.  Attorney Middleton just appointed to case. Request 30 day reset.  State has no objection.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Absolute Sobriety; No violent/abusive contact w/JLM

Defendant Justin J. May in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton and Josh Andreasen.  Defendant Justin J. May in custody.  Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Mr. Andreasen argues motion to modify the bond.  Revocation hearing is set for Sept. 2015.  State responds.  Court rules to modify to a $1,000.00 SIGNATURE bond.  Conditions from cash bond to continue on to the Signature bond.

Pre-trial conference at 07-24-2015 10:15 am.
Return date at 08-05-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Justin J. May appeared by video means with Intern, Josh Andreasen and Attorney Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Defendant does qualify and defendant is also on a hold through probation.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $1000 cash bond with conditions.  PD request $500 cash bond.  Defendant is employed.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date. $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No violent or abusive contact with JLM, law enforcement, St. Clare Hospital and paramedic staff.  Absolute sobriety.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
